text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with coconut milk corned beef and
cabbage you know once in a while i get
these ideas
some people call them you know wacky and
this is one of them i thought what would
happen if we did a regular corned beef
and cabbage but instead of the
traditional braising liquid we would use
a thai style coconut milk red curry
combination so here's what i did i took
a regular four pound corned beef
you got your fat side and you got your
lean side so i'm gonna start that fat
side up i really don't think it matters
i'm gonna pour in a can of coconut milk
i'm also gonna add a teaspoon of red
curry paste super hot please read the
blog post about that particular
ingredient all this stuff is available
at regular normal large American
supermarkets so I don't think there's
anything in here you're not going to be
able to find all right I'm gonna throw
in a quart of cold water I'm gonna toss
in a couple bay leaves a teaspoon of
coriander a splash of fish sauce and
some tomato paste I have no idea why I
spread the tomato paste over the corned
beef before I started in there was no
reason for that although that's a
perfect example of why cooking's fun are
we gonna put that on high heat we're
gonna bring it up to a simmer any time
we're simmering meat as you well know if
any kind of foamy stuff comes to the top
skim it off so that's what I did I'm
gonna add a mirepoix which is just fancy
French cooking term for celery carrots
onions now I want these pieces to be
recognizable in the end product I don't
feel like adding them towards the end I
want to cook them all the way through so
I cut them in nice big chunks all right
so once my veggies are in and this comes
to a simmer I'm gonna back the heat down
to low cover and cook for three hours
now halfway through I like to flip it
over you don't have to but I do I'm
gonna put the lid back on and continue
cooking so that is three hours
altogether simmering on low covered at
that point we're gonna uncover all right
the corned beef is getting close but
it's not quite done yet I'm gonna add my
yellow potatoes I'm using Yukon Gold any
potato works I cut up half a green
cabbage in big chunks I'm gonna poke
that down into the broth so we're gonna
continue to cook until the cabbage is
often sweet and the potatoes are tender
so maybe 3540 minutes you decide check
it after half-hour at that point we're
gonna pull the meat out of the broth
you're definitely gonna want to taste
this broth for seasoning depending on
how salty the corned beef was you may or
may not need salt all right you're also
definitely gonna want to check for
spiciness all right that red curry paste
is hot but we didn't use that much so if
you want a spicier add a little more of
that or cayenne of course and there we
go before we serve this we're gonna trim
off any excess fat from the top now very
important find the grain see those
fibers see how they're running that way
we have to slice across the grain by the
way I don't like the term against the
grain against the grain sounds like I
don't know an old Rage Against the
Machine song all right so we're gonna
slice this across the grain nice thin
pieces man that looks good to serve this
up we're gonna ladle some of those
veggies with that delicious slightly
spicy coconut broth into a bowl top it
with our perfectly across the grain
slice corned beef so beautiful and
delicious they could certainly eat this
with a fork but for me I'm gonna go with
a spoon not only do I want to be elite
the chunks I also want to be able to
taste that beautiful beautiful coconut
milk broth I didn't have any and I was a
little afraid to be honest but if you
wanted to add some fresh chopped
cilantro to this probably would be
really good and this is one of those
recipes as I was making it I was
thinking you're such an idiot
this is never gonna work you just wasted
a perfectly good corn bead but happily
it came out better than I thought it
would super great change of pace anyway
I hope you give this a try all the
ingredients are on the site as usual and
as always enjoy
